job_title: Business & Strategy Support Assistant in Edinburgh, Scotland
pros: Colleagues and managers in my department were amazing - friendly, helpful, fun to spend time with, and gave me all I needed to succeed at the job.
cons: Since the job was part of the Kickstart program, it only paid £9.50 per hour for 25 hours per week.

pros: Depending on the team that you work with, it can be a good experience. A lot of motivated, compassionate and friendly individuals.
cons: Very disorganised - when I started, the work equipment had not been delivered and I had to chase the relevant department. The application process is too complex - the online system is messy. Based on my experience, the management were controlling, discouraging and nervous. One of my managers tended to present with the sense of urgency most of the time. Reactive and little investment in the staff wellbeing and development. Technically, there are in-house courses but they are not in-depth. Over 12 months in post, I did not have any external meetings and only one training session provided by an external organisation. Salaries tend to be lower for the equivalent jobs in other charities.
